utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Can you just tell me a little bit about what brings you in here today?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I I have a cough.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and uh, what kind of cough is it like a dry cough? Or is it more like productive cough?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I always seem to bring up some gunk on my when I cough.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and what what colour is this gunk?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's green, sometimes yellowish.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you noticed at all any kind of blood in the cough?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Well, no blood.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK, and how much of the gunk or the sputum would you say you bring up every day?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh a couple of kleenexes. Um, I'll use, but so not that much.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. an and when did this start?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's really hard to say I've had a cough for the past few years now, but I feel like it's getting worse.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and is your cough just constant or does it come and go?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I do cough throughout the day, but I find it's worse in the morning.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and is there anything that brings on your cough?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I can't think of anything that triggers the cough, just worse when I get up in the morning.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And you mentioned you've been having this cough over the past few years. Has it been getting worse at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I would say the coughs were getting worse the last few years. Slowly though.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you had any previous episodes of this cough with sputum like gunk, gunky material before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I've been having this ongoing for the last few years.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK And is there anything that you do or have tried that's made your coughing get either better or worse?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: If I take a deep breath, then it seems to make the cough worse and uh nothing really helps the cough go away though.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um and other than that, have you been having any other symptoms, like a runny nose, sore throat, difficulty breathing, anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you recently traveled outside of the country?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I haven't traveled anywhere.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you noticed any other symptoms like fevers or chills?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No fever and no chills.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any night sweats?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No night sweats.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any increased fatigue or just feeling tired overall?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, these last few months by energy has been low. I I've been feeling a lot more tired than usual.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you noticed at all any kind of swelling in your hands, feet, ankles?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, I think they're always a little swollen, but I might have just gained a few pounds over the years.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and, have you been having any palpitations like a racing heart or any chest pain at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, no chest pain.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and how about shortness of breath?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um. I only have trouble breathing if I walk a few blocks or go up a few flights of stairs into my apartment.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Have you been having any kind of urinary issues?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Ummm only at night time I seem to have to get up a lot to use the bathroom.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and how about your bowel movements, any constipation or diarrhea?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um no bowel issues.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and have you been getting enough sleep?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh yeah I would say or sorry no my sleep has been has been poor

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and do you find that you wake up during the night to take a breath or anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't had to wake up in the middle of the night short of breath or anything like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and do you ever have to use a multiple pillows?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um no I just used one pillow.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And have you noticed you've had any significant weight loss or weight gain in the last few few months?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um I maybe lost 5 pounds in the last few months. I wasn't even, I haven't been trying to lose weight but doesn't hurt though as I've I've gained a few pounds over the years so I don't mind.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And how is your appetite been like?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh appetite's been good I feel like I've been eating normally.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And have you had any recent infections at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No recent infections.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and I think I mentioned this before, but any know any runny nose sore throat, any of those viral symptoms?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, no runny nose, no sore throat, been feeling good.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Awesome, and have you had have you been exposed to anyone with tuberculosis in the past?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um no, I actually had a tuberculosis test for work and it was normal.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And have you been diagnosed with any medical conditions at all, like high blood pressure, diabetes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um my blood pressure has been high and that was diagnosed in the last few years.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And do you take any medications for your blood pressure?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yes, I take um, Lisinopril.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and do you have any allergies to any medications at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Nothing I can think of.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you been hospitalized at all before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And do you have any ill contacts near anyone that has been sick around you recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No ill contacts. And sorry I for hospitalizations I I did have a c-section for the birth of my daughter and I was in the hospital for a few days for that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, but nothing else?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and have you had any other surgeries other than your c-section?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No just the c-section.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, in terms of your family history has anyone had any cardiovascular issues or any cancers?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, my father had a heart attack when he was 78. And um he unfortunately passed away from it, but had no cancer in the family.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any like asthma in the family?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Not that I can think of.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and currently, where do you live? Do you live in apartment, in a house?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I live in an apartment with my husband and our daughter.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and do you currently work?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I I work at the local grocery store.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And just in your daily routine, how would you say, how is your diet and exercise like?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um diet I'll usually eat one or two meals a day and sometimes snack throughout the day as well but we eat a variety of meats and vegetables, and so I think our diet is pretty good. But exercise don't have time for for that currently.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and do you use any recreational drugs like marijuana?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um noo, I would never use that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how about alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: A glass of wine. I have three or four nights a week.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and is it like a full glass of wine or like just, how much would you say?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Glass of Wine is for me. I would say is like 5 or 6 ounces like a typical glass of wine.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Do you smoke at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I do smoke cigarettes, yes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and how much are you smoking an average day?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um over a pack, one to two packs of cigarettes per day for the last nearly 40 years.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
